Class NewIssueController

java.lang.Object
controller.NewIssueController
public class NewIssueController extends Object
Controller responsible for creating and editing issues in the application. Manages the new issue form, including fields for title, description, assignee, status, priority, due date, and tags. Handles validation, issue creation or update, and delegates persistence and navigation actions to the main controller.
Version:
0.2
Author:
Artur Twardzik

  • Constructor Details

    • NewIssueController

      public NewIssueController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      JavaFX initialization method. Sets up tooltips, keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl/Cmd + Enter for create/save, Ctrl/Cmd + R for back), and populates ComboBoxes for assignees, status, and priority with default values.

    • backBtnClicked

      void backBtnClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler triggered when the back button is clicked. Delegates returning to the previous view to the main controller.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event

    • createBtnClicked

      void createBtnClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler triggered when the create/save button is clicked. Validates title and description fields, creates a new Issue or updates an existing one, assigns tags and due date, and delegates persistence to the main controller. Displays toast notifications for feedback.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event

    • setIssue

      public void setIssue(Issue issue)
      Sets the current issue to be edited. Populates all relevant UI fields with the issue's data and updates the create/save button label.
      Parameters:
      issue - the issue to edit

    • setParent

      public void setParent(MainAppWindowController mainWindow)
      Sets the parent main window controller for navigation and shared data access.
      Parameters:
      mainWindow - the main application window controller

    • setExceptionListerner

      public void setExceptionListerner(ChildControllerListener eventListerner)
      Registers an exception listener to report errors that occur during issue creation or update.
      Parameters:
      eventListerner - the listener to notify on exceptions

    • setFocusOnTitle

      public void setFocusOnTitle()
      Requests focus on the title field, typically used when the view is first displayed to improve user experience.
